desc: These bugs appear to rise from clouds of ash.
name: Ashsprite

desc: The surface of this bug's shell shimmers like oil.
name: Aurorabee

desc: This blue bug has sharp little teeth.
name: Blueback

desc: Vibrant and beautiful, it has a friendly little smile on its face.
name: Brightstripe

desc: A bright yellow bug, its wings smell like butter.
name: Butterbee

desc: Thrives in desolate conditions.
name: Cinderfly

desc: A lively bug, it can be seen drinking morning dew.
name: Dewhopper

desc: This bug makes a faint ringing sound as it flies through the air.
name: Driftbell

desc: The trail of a dustmoth looks like stardust.
name: Dustmoth

desc: Its tawny wings make it hard to spot on trees.
name: Fawnfly

desc: A large, formidable bug. Can survive extreme heat.
name: Fireygiant

desc: Hot to the touch, its shell flickers like flame.
name: Flameroach

desc: This bug is easily mistaken for a snowflake.
name: Frostfleck

desc: Where there's frost, there are frostflies.
name: Frostfly

desc: These bugs float on updrafts of poisonous gases.
name: Gasgiant

desc: The warmer this bug gets, the more it glows.
name: Glowbug

desc: A bug with glistening gold wings, very fancy!
name: Goldbuck

desc: This bug looks like it's wearing tiny green shoes.
name: Greentip

desc: Attracted to heat, this little guy needs warmth.
name: Heathugger

desc: This bug never stops eating.
name: Hivehog

desc: This bug's wings are frozen over.
name: Icetip

desc: This tiny creature skips across hot lakes of lava.
name: Lavahopper

desc: These bugs can be seen dancing at dusk.
name: Muddancer

desc: This bug is incredibly sticky. It has two long horns on its head.
name: Mudstag

desc: The smallest and most pathetic bug I've ever seen.
name: Orphanfly

desc: This bug rubs its legs together to produce tiny sparks.
name: Phoenixfly

desc: This little bug's legs are covered in see-through hairs.
name: Polarmoth

desc: Not to be confused with the infamous Dreadwing.
name: Redwing

desc: Who would live in the desert? This clown.
name: Sandclown

desc: This bug's legs move so fast they're difficult to count.
name: Scuttleploom

desc: This bug has a snout like a seahorse.
name: Seahornet

desc: Hard to spot, these bugs are as black as night.
name: Shadowmoth

desc: The wings of this bug are iridescent like ice.
name: Shardwing

desc: It looks as if it could slip out of its shell at a moments notice.
name: Shellcreep

desc: The tips of its legs are covered in snow.
name: Snowskater

desc: You'll smell one of these little guys before you see one.
name: Stinkjack

desc: This pretty bug loves sunshine.
name: Sunskipper

desc: A steaming cup of Earl Grey.
name: Teacup

desc: This prickly little fellow has razor sharp wings.
name: Thornbee

desc: Comes out only during certain phases of the moon.
name: Tidefly

desc: Its legs look like intertwining vines.
name: Vineclimber

desc: A bug that can usually be found chasing the crest of a wave.
name: Wavebird

desc: This guy has a creepy little face.
name: Xenofly
